thread.title: Gallery | A decade-plus of Colts vs. Patriots
thread.title_full: Gallery | A decade-plus of Colts vs. Patriots

title: Gallery | A decade-plus of Colts vs. Patriots
text: Gallery | A decade-plus of Colts vs. Patriots Buy Photo The Colts lost 38-34 on Nov. 30, 2003, when Edgerrin James was stopped on a fourth-down run from the 2. Patriots linebacker Willie McGinest, who had left the game with an injury not long before, helped on the tackle and sprinted to midfield to celebrate. Matt Detrich / IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo Patriots safety Rodney Harrison intercepts a pass intended for Marcus Pollard in the AFC title game on Jan. 18, 2004. The Patriots won 24-14. Matt Kryger / IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo Peyton Manning likes earning a 40-21 win over the Patriots on Nov. 7, 2005. The Colts were undefeated at the time. Sam Riche / IndyStar Buy Photo Patriots coach Bill Belichick seemed, um, preoccupied before the Nov. 4, 2007 matchup. The Patriots won 24-20. Sam Riche / IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo 'He fumbled the frickin' football ... TOUCHDOWN!!!!' That, roughly, was radio man Bob Lamey's call when center Jeff Saturday recovered a Dominic Rhodes fumble in the end zone during the Colts' AFC title game win over the Patriots. Matt Detrich / IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo Joseph Addai gets a hug from Dallas Clark after scoring the winning touchdown in a 38-34 Colts win in the AFC title game. The Colts went on to win the Super Bowl. Robert Scheer / IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo In what might be the most famous tackle in Colts history, Melvin Bullitt stops Kevin Faulk on fourth-and-2 in a 35-34 Colts win on Nov. 15, 2009. Sam Riche / IndyStar Fullscreen Buy Photo Indy lost 31-28 in Peyton Manning's last game as a Colt against the Patriots on Nov. 21, 2010. Sam Riche / IndyStar
